snippet.textDisplay: Solidarity with our hardy Nigerian brothers and sisters. We must demand that the Nigerian police state be dissolved whilst resisting the urge to call for easy solutions, i.e., imperialist interventions.
snippet.textOriginal: Solidarity with our hardy Nigerian brothers and sisters. We must demand that the Nigerian police state be dissolved whilst resisting the urge to call for easy solutions, i.e., imperialist interventions.

snippet.textDisplay: Totally agree. The U.K. gives 13.4 billion sterling in aid per year and Nigeria is in the top ten recipients. Interfering in foreign countries corrupts local politics. We should also stop investing in Nigerian businesses as many of these prop up and enrich corrupt politicians. Time for the West in general to pull completely out of Nigeria and leave the imperialism to China. No aid, no investment, no troops. Just stay away from developing countries and let them develop their own way.
